problem_text:
Let G be any non-trivial finite group, and let X be any generating set for G. Is it true that every element of G can be obtained from X using fewer than 2 log2 |G| multiplications? (When counting the number of mutiplications on a path from the generators to a given element, at each step one can use the elements obtained at previous steps.)
C. R. Leedham-Green
